title: Morningstar’s Guide to Semiliquid Funds - Morningstar
summary:
Morningstar’s inaugural report analyzes the semiliquid funds landscape, including semiliquid fund structures, vehicles and asset classes, fees, and more.
Kephart also notes that semiliquid funds come in various structures, such as interval funds, tender offer funds, nontraded business development companies, and nontraded real estate investment trusts.
Interval Funds: What to Know Interval funds are one of the most common types of semiliquid funds.
The Morningstar Medalist Rating for Semiliquid Funds In May 2025, Morningstar introduced the Morningstar Medalist Rating for Semiliquid Funds, applying Morningstar’s Medalist Rating framework to the growing segment of semiliquid investment vehicles.
It covers a wide range of funds in the United States, as well as European long-term investment funds, United Kingdom long-term asset funds, and certain Australia-domiciled managed investment schemes.
